block.p: Dr. Mary Jude Cox, a daughter of Judith and Stuart T. Cox of Little Silver, N.J., was married yesterday to John Jay Hoffman, the son of Judith and John A. Hoffman of Piscataway, N.J. The Rev. Jerome M. Nolan performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of the Nativity in Fair Haven, N.J.

Dr. Cox, 32, is keeping her name. She is an ophthalmologist at Eye Physicians, a group practice with offices in Voorhees and Cherry Hill, both in New Jersey. She is also on the staff of Wills Eye Hospital in Philadelphia. She graduated from the University of Virginia and its medical school.

Dr. Mary Jude Cox, a daughter of Judith and Stuart T. Cox of Little Silver, N.J., was married yesterday to John Jay Hoffman, the son of Judith and John A. Hoffman of Piscataway, N.J. The Rev. Jerome M. Nolan performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of the Nativity in Fair Haven, N.J.

Dr. Cox, 32, is keeping her name. She is an ophthalmologist at Eye Physicians, a group practice with offices in Voorhees and Cherry Hill, both in New Jersey. She is also on the staff of Wills Eye Hospital in Philadelphia. She graduated from the University of Virginia and its medical school.

Mr. Hoffman, 38, is a trial attorney in the civil division of the Justice Department in Washington. A graduate of Colgate University, the bridegroom received both a J.D. and a Master of Laws degree in comparative and international law from Duke.

The fathers of the bride and bridegroom work together at Wilentz, Goldman & Spitzer, a law firm in Woodbridge, N.J. Mr. Cox is a senior partner and Mr. Hoffman is the managing partner. The bride's mother teaches kindergarten at the Rumson Country Day School, a private school in Rumson, N.J.
